commitMessage:
@@@Prohibit append-only writes targeting backing indices directly. (#57788)

Append-only writes can only target the corresponding data stream.

Relates to #53100

@@@Add a template parameter to override auto_create_index value (#61858)

Closes #20640.

This PR introduces a new parameter to v2 templates.  `allow_auto_create`. 
which allows templates to override the cluster setting `auto_create_index`.
Notes:

   * `AutoCreateIndex` now looks for a matching v2 template.  and if its
     `allow_auto_create` setting is true.  it overrides the usual logic.
   * `TransportBulkAction` previously used `AutoCreateIndex` to check
     whether missing indices should be created. We now rely on
     `AutoCreateAction`.  which was already differentiating between creating
     indices and creating data streams.  I've updated `AutoCreateAction` to
     use `AutoCreateIndex`. Data streams are also influenced by
     `allow_auto_create`.  in that their default auto-create behaviour can
     be disabled with this setting.
   * Most of the Java file changes are due to introducing an extra
     constructor parameter to `ComposableIndexTemplate`.
   * I've added the new setting to various x-pack templates
   * I added a YAML test to check that watches can be created even when
     `auto_create_index` is `false`.

@@@Add startTime field to create data stream action request class. (#77660)

The startTime field only exists for testing purposes. In order
to reliable control the name of the backing index being created
as part of this action. Note this field is not exposed on the
rest layer.

Change DataStreamIT#testCreatingDataStreamAndFirstBackingIndexExistsFails() to
use this new field.

Other changes:
* Removed testAutoCreatingDataStreamAndFirstBackingIndexExistsFails() test.
  This test also tests what testCreatingDataStreamAndFirstBackingIndexExistsFails()
  is testing and in order to test it properly we would need to change the index action
  request in the same way the create data stream action request is changed.
* Use `backingIndexEqualTo([name].  [gen])` over
  `equalTo(DataStream.getDefaultBackingIndexName([name].  [gen]))` where possible.
  This way of asserting isn't prone to timing and is easier to use.

Closes #77307
